reviews.review_msg: There are a lot of writing assignments but if you can grasp the concepts and structure its easy to do well! This prof is great at providing feed back and was alway available if students had questions or to discuss upcoming assignments. There are a lot of readings but you only really need to read what youll be writing about.

Cynthia was great. She was soooo helpful, especially via email. A lot of these readings and assignments were very philosophical and she really helps break it down into more understandable topics. She wants her students to succeed and preaches that to her students.
Lots of work, but she really cares. Always gives excellent and thorough feedback. Very cool, admirable person. Very understanding and fair.

Cindy is the best prof I've ever had. I am so glad she was my 250 prof in my first semester. She's been such a mentor to me, and has really helped me to develop my skills. My time at SFU would not be the same without her. She's super respected in her field and she really cares. DEFINITELY take a course with her, but be prepared to WRITE!!!
Cynthia is a great prof! Shes very helpful with assignments if you take the time to email her or go see her. She corrects things in a way which makes you comprehend how to fix it.

I really enjoyed listening to Cynthia's perspective on social issues. She's had a lot of experience doing research and teaching and she's very straightforward and outspoken. This was an intersession course so there wasn't very much lecture, if at all. Most of the class time was used to help us improve our writing and research skills.

Dr. Patton is the most respected professor I have ever had the privilege to take a course with. You can get a very high mark in her class if you put in the effort: she is a very forgiving grader and rewards effort. Beware that if you don't like reading and discussion, you won't like her class: there is no lecture, just group discussion in class.

Cynthia is an awesome professor! Although the class was quite "dry" at some points she is a great prof that really takes the time to help. I felt a bit discouraged after my first 2 papers but Cynthia took the time to really go through everything with me and made me work hard for my grade. Awesome person and the class was interesting.

She's a great prof. However, you won't make it if you don't have strong organizational skills and a strong motivation to succeed. If you have both, then you're bound to get a great mark. If you don't you'll probably regret taking her class. Seminars mainly consist of group discussion, so you absolutely need to do your research before class.

Absolutely amazing prof, the best I've had at sfu! She is a very fair mark, gives thorough feedback, and really gets to know all of her students personally. She really pushes you to do your best and doesn't put any time restraints on assignments. very understanding and approachable... her outlines and criteria are a bit vague for assignments tho.
Be prepared to write essay after essay. She is a fair marker and provides excellent feedback. Go to every class and participate. Best professor Ive had to date!

Cynthia is incredible. Never before have I felt like a proff was really on my side in the way she was for our whole class. From the fairness of grading- to accommodating due dates and just her all around passion for the subject she made this condensed class super tolerable and the least stressful part of the semester

Go to class (pop quizs/assignments), show your respects and efforts! Its my second time taking course with Cindy, she is just awesome not just because of her grading style, but also my writing have actually improved! HIGHLY RECOMMEND *thumbs up

Cindy is definitely my favourite prof in SA department. She is like my mentor. She cares about her students and help them based on their capabilities. If you are the first time taking class with Cindy, you might find her a bit disorganized. BUT don't stress about it, just talk to her! And, what is better than an easy A?

One of the best classes that I took because she actually cares about teaching her students. She did not test us nor expect us to memorize random and pointless information as many other profs do. Fair marker, lots of projects and readings. Everyone gets a chance to get an A in the class, only if they work hard for it. Would love to have her again.

Dr. Patton is a wonderful person and she really knows her stuff,  but be prepared to work your butt off in this class. Don't think about skipping class because you have quizzes or group assignments almost every day (makes up a large % of your grade). And, prepare for some REALLY long take-home exams that require quite a bit of detail.
may be good researcher not a good teacher very disorganized highly defensive at class
